data.title: Fun and good
data.text: The cantina is on a rooftop in historic old Santa Fe. The food is adapted Mexican, marrying combinations of flavors into excellent meals. Starting with an appetizer of chips and three salsas ( excellent) we moved on to fish tacos and pork tacos. Both were very different from standard Mexican tacos but both were outstanding.  A lot of food. In our case, both light eaters, we could have shared one entree.

data.title: Average at Best
data.text: Ordered a "House" Margarita... Terrible... too sour, had them remake it, which was better, but not good. Ordered the Chicken Machaca Tostada salad. The chicken lacked flavor and was dry.  We were wondering if there is new management since our food and drinks have always been good in the past. Disappointing.

data.title: Dissapointing.
data.text: Have always liked the variety of the menu and the quality of the food. This time however the food was not up to their previous level. The meat in the chili Colorado was very dry and did not have much flavor. Same thing with the Mexican lasagna. It was dry and not very tasty. The service was very good and the restaurant is still nice and vibrant. But the food was very disappointing. With so many other Mexican restaurants in this area, its hard to justify going to Coyote Cantina, when there are so many other choices.

data.title: Unique and Tasty Mexican Food!
data.text: Dinner with friends who took us here on recent trip to the South Bay. We really enjoy Mexican food, this place has a unique menu. Had the blackened chicken enchiladas. Tasty, fresh.

data.title: Very friendly, local restaurant
data.text: The place is relatively small, and always busy. It has a lot of regulars, and many people eating there know each other and the staff. The food is very good. It has many non-traditional dishes, so be prepared to have some excellent food that you probably have never had before. Highly recommended

data.title: LOVE this place
data.text:
This is a great Mexican restaurant in the southbay.  Service is always great, super tasty cocktails, and yummy food!  I am obsessed with their queso starter.  Where I grew up, creamy cheesy queso was standard at all Mexican restaurants, not that weird chorizo stuff that so many SoCal restaurants serve where the cheese is hard after like 1 minute.  This is ooey gooey cheesiness with plenty of tomotoes, onions, and peppers to give it a nice kick.  I hope they never get rid of this!
The quesadillas, burritos, and salads are all great (that's what I've ordered).  The margaritas and mojitos are all tasty.  I have a sweet tooth and I'm pretty sure this place uses pre-made mixes but I don't mind at this kind of a place.  It's a cheap, close, friendly place to go to for the Americanized Mexican food that I like. :)

data.title: Just so so Mexican food!
data.text:
The decor and wait staff were great. The chips were nice and hot but the salsa is just a thin sauce, but it has a nice flavor. 

I ordered chili verde in a burrito and it was just okay. The sauce was not authentic and tasted like something I could get in a can at Ralph's. My friend ordered enchiladas, rice and beans and said they were pretty good. 

I should go back and try something different just to be fair, but I'm still looking for my favorite mexican food restaurant in the south bay. 

 It looks like a fun place to drink tequila, margaritas and eat lots of chips and salsa!

data.title: Sweet corn ravioli - you need to try this
data.text: Charming place in south Redondo Beach, which has some typical gourmet Mexican dishes, along with one that is not found in many other places:  sweet corn ravioli in an anejo sauce.  This is a 'must-try', and I highly recommend it.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Best Margaritas and Mexican food in Redondo -actually the beach cities.  Atmosphere is wonderful but a bit noisy.

data.title: Mexican Fusion
data.text: This is Mexican food with a real twist. My favorite is the Mexican lasagna. It's lasagna noodles with Mexican flavors. The quesedillas have Brie. Such clever deviations from the traditional. It's hard to choose.

data.title: Solid Mexican food, great value
data.text: Cozy place with solid food that checks all the right boxes for comfort, casual and cost. No culinary surprises, but who cares. It works. Only consideration is it's not a large place so may want to plan ahead with bigger group. That said, never had a problem getting seated for two on a weekend.

data.title: Lunch Stop
data.text: I understand that the happy hour is good but there was no room at the bar to partake.  HH is at bar only and its a super small area.  Food wasn't bad.  Would do Taco Tuesday again  but not certain on other dinner items

data.title: Excellent food, but YOU MUST step outside of the traditional Mexican dishes!
data.text: So this place has some out of this world food, but only, and I repeat ONLY if you order something out of the ordinary. Yes, you can go and order your typical burrito, taco or enchilada and it will be acceptable, but may seem overpriced for what you get. Where this place shines is the unique dishes like the sweet corn ravioli, garlic cream blackened enchiladas, and the jalapeno glazed steak bits. The dishes I mentioned and many others are what keep me coming back to this establishment. The service is on point and the drinks are strong. If I had to take a mark off for this place it would be the salsa, I prefer a more chunky salsa but they have a more watery chili sauce, however it tastes good and goes well with the chips. Heed my advice and you won't go wrong here!!

data.title: Great neighborhood feel!
data.text: I love Coyote Cantina.  The food is always consistent and super good.  It is also a great place for families, they are great to kids and make it enjoyable for all.  I have never tried something I did not like here and just love that it has a friendly neighborhood feel!

data.title: Fabulous Mexican Restaurant in Redondo Beach
data.text: Loved the chips and salsa.  Enchiladas and tacos are great.  Carnitas are fabulous. Everything on the menu looks great!

data.title: Comfort food heaven
data.text: Nice little mexican cantina in Redondo beach. You have to look for it a bit since it's in a strip mall. Staff made me feel very welcome, and I lucked out, getting there right for happy hour. Got a couple of HH menu items, a couple of pints and a mixed plate, and did not regret my choice. This place has ambiance by the bucket, looks like a spot with a lot of regulars and the food was great. Nothing to dislike about this spot. Even the prices were very reasonable for the quality of the food and drinks.

data.title: Not just great Tex-Mex Food!
data.text:
For all lovers of tequila - you want to be here!  For people (like me) with spouses who aren't fans of Tex-Mex food - NEVER FEAR!  They have some amazing salads and pastas and "Tex-Mex" that's less "Mex."  For example, Buffalo Bleu Cheese Chicken Quesadilla; Salmon Salad
(resh salmon and grilled vegetables tossed in a fire-roasted tomato vinaigrette, served on a bed of organic field greens, topped with homemade potato chips); and my personal go - to favorite, Pasta California (Sautéed breast of chicken, roasted corn and fresh avocado tossed in a jack cheese cream sauce with New Mexico chile linguini)....it's fabulous!  We go here every several months (we don't eat out much) and it's really a reliable local favorite.

data.title: Not quite as good...
data.text: Went here today for the first time in about 5 years. Before today we went quite regularly and I've always asked for the California Chicken. It wasn't as good today. The sauce was very runny and there was an overabundance of it in regards to the other ingredients. It was still good, just not quite the same. Maybe their cook was having an off day, who knows. The waitress however was snotty. The type the doesn't smile, but when she does, you can tell it's fake. The type where you feel like an inconvenience. Maybe they're ALL having an off day.

data.title: One hit and a couple misses
data.text:
Our family eats a lot of Mexican food. A lot. We tried Coyote Cantina our first night in Redondo Beach as it was within walking distance from our hotel and had some excellent ratings on both Trip Advisor and Yelp. 

The wife ordered blackened chicken enchiladas, two of us had burritos and our youngest had a chicken finger kids meal. The wifes was by far and away the best as the garlic creme sauce was a fantastic topper to the chicken enchiladas. Unfortunately, that was the one hit for the meal. I had a carne asade burrito and while it was as big as my head, the steak was rough and the bean/rice combo on the interior made for a bland tasting mess, especially compared to the wife's selection. Finally, the kids meal was two small chicken breasts on a plate -- not sure how you screw up a kids menu staple, but they did. Even with the largely average food, the worst part was our service. Multiple times we had to ask for drink refills, condiments, etc. Our waitress was disinterested and spent more time talking with a coworker by the bar then attending to our table. Maybe it was just a bad night for everyone, but for $70+ after tip for 3 entrees and a kids meal, I expected more.

data.title: Makes You Sit Up and Take Notice of Tasty Yet Potent Drinks
data.text: This is a happening locals place.   Small area, but very well utilized.  Plenty of conversation opportunities with the patrons, the food is pretty good.   The bar and the decor and the energy of the place makes you want to come back with friends.
